data.title: RRB NTPC 2024 Notification, 10884 Vacancy Out, Exam Dates
data.meta_description: RRB NTPC offers 10884 non-technical posts within the Indian Railways in 2024. The official authorities are expected to release the RRB NTPC 2024 Notification soon
data.text:
RRB NTPC 2024 Notification:The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) is set to release the RRB NTPC 2024 Notification for Level 2, 3, 5, and 6 posts. This recruitment drive aims to fill 10,884 vacancies in the Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC). The positions include Junior Clerk cum Typist, Accounts Clerk cum Typist, Junior Time Keeper, Trains Clerk, Commercial cum Ticket Clerk, Traffic Assistant, Goods Guard, Senior Commercial cum Ticket Clerk, Senior Clerk cum Typist, Junior Account Assistant cum Typist, Senior Time Keeper, Commercial Apprentice, and Station Master across various Zonal Railways and Production Units of Indian Railways.

RRB NTPC 2024 Notification

The RRB NTPC Recruitment 2024 stands out as one of India’s most extensive selection processes, seeking candidates for numerous non-technical roles within the Indian Railways. This examination aims to fill vacancies in positions like Clerk, Traffic Assistant, Goods Guard, Station Master, Commercial Apprentice, and various others. These roles fall under the non-technical category, emphasizing the absence of the necessity for specialized technical expertise or qualifications. Detailed RRB NTPC 2024 Notification will be released soon

RRB NTPC Notification 2024

According to the RRB Exam Calendar 2024, the Railway Board will release the RRB NTPC Notification 2024 in August 2024 to recruit 10,884 Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC) vacancies in Indian Railways. The official notice for these vacancies was released on 25th July 2024. This recruitment drive will fill thousands of positions in NTPC categories. Candidates with a minimum educational qualification or its equivalent, seeking government jobs in the Indian Railway, can refer to the previous year’s notification PDF for reference until the new notification is released.

RRB NTPC 2024 Vacancy Out

Indian Railways has announced the RRB NTPC Vacancy. According to the notice, RRB will recruit 10,884 Non-Technical Popular Categories (NTPC) vacancies for both graduate and undergraduate level posts. Given that RRB ALP vacancies were recently increased, there is a possibility that RRB NTPC vacancies may also be increased. Previously, the total number of NTPC vacancies was 35,281. Below is a table summarizing the post-wise and educational qualification-wise vacancies.

RRB NTPC Selection Process

The RRB NTPC Selection Process involves several stages tailored to specific job roles:

1. Station Master and Traffic Assistant: Candidates for these roles go through CBT 1, 2, CBAT, document verification, and a medical examination.

2. Junior Clerk cum Typist, Junior Time Keeper, Accounts Clerk cum Typist, Senior Clerk cum Typist, Junior Account Assistant cum Typist, and Senior Time Keeper: The selection process includes CBT 1, 2, Typing Skill Test, document verification, and a medical examination.

3. Trains Clerk, Commercial cum Ticket Clerk, Goods Guard, Senior Commercial cum Ticket Clerk, Commercial Apprentice: For these positions, candidates undergo CBT 1, 2, followed by document verification and a medical examination.

RRB NTPC 2024 Eligibility Criteria

The Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) sets eligibility requirements for the RRB NTPC exam. Age restrictions, educational prerequisites, and citizenship requirements are some of these requirements. Here are the RRB NTPC Eligibility Criteria 2024:

Nationality:

Candidates must be either:

a citizen of India, or

a subject of Nepal, or

a subject of Bhutan, or

a Tibetan refugee who entered India before January 1, 1962, to stay permanently,

a person of Indian descent who immigrated from the following countries to settle in India:

Pakistan

Burma

Sri Lanka

Kenya

Uganda

The United Republic of Tanzania

Zambia

Malawi

Zaire

Ethiopia

Vietnam

Age Limit:

The age requirements for the RRB NTPC exam vary according to different categories.

Minimum Age: 18 years

Maximum Age: 30 years/33 years

Educational Qualifications:

Candidates must hold a credential issued by an accredited educational institution or board. It’s possible that the position-specific requirements will change. The minimum required level of education is as follows:

12th class or equivalent required for Junior Clerk, Junior Time Keeper, Accounts Clerk, Senior Clerk, and Senior Time Keeper.

Bachelor’s degree in any field from a recognized university for Traffic Assistant and Goods Guard.

All other positions require a Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university.

RRB NTPC Exam Age Relaxation

Age relaxations are provided by the Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) for candidates belonging to various categories as per government norms. The age relaxation criteria for the RRB NTPC exam are as follows:

Scheduled Caste/Scheduled Tribe (SC/ST) Category: Maximum Age Relaxation: 5 years

Other Backward Classes (OBC) Category: Maximum Age Relaxation: 3 years

Ex-Servicemen (Ex-SM): Maximum Age Relaxation: The relaxation is provided based on the length of military service plus 3 years. Additionally, candidates who have completed at least 6 months of continuous service in the Armed Forces are eligible for relaxation.

Persons with Benchmark Disabilities (PwBD) Category:

General Category: Maximum Age Relaxation: 10 years

OBC Category: Maximum Age Relaxation: 13 years

SC/ST Category: Maximum Age Relaxation: 15 years

Widows, Divorced Women (Separated Judicially): Maximum Age Relaxation: Up to 35 years for the UR category, 38 years for the OBC category, and 40 years for SC/ST category.

RRB NTPC 2024 Application Form

To initiate the process for the RRB NTPC 2024 apply Online, follow these steps:

1. Go to the specific RRB regional web portal.

2. Look for the section labeled “Recruitment of NTPC 2024.”

3. Click on “Registration” to set up your account.

4. Log in using the provided credentials.

5. Enter your personal details and educational qualifications.

6. Upload essential documents like your photograph and signature.

7. Complete the application by paying the prescribed fee, then submit your application.

RRB NTPC 2024 Application Fees

Application fees for RRB NTPC 2024 differ based on categories:

General & OBC: ₹500/-

SC/ST, Ex-Servicemen, PwBD, Women, Transgender, Minorities, and Economically Backward Classes: ₹250/-

A partial refund is applicable: General & OBC candidates will receive a ₹400 refund if they appear for the CBT 1 exam out of the ₹500 fee. SC/ST, Ex-Servicemen, PwBD, Women, Transgender, Minorities, and Economically Backward Classes will receive a full refund of ₹250.

RRB NTPC 2024 Admit Card

The Admit Card for RRB NTPC 2024 can be downloaded from the official website of RRB once the link is activated. It will be available zone-wise on the Regional Recruitment Boards’ websites. The specific release date for the admit card has not been announced yet.

Here are the essential documents required for the RRB NTPC exam:

1. Valid ID Proof with a photograph.

2. Passport-sized photograph.

3. Copy of the RRB NTPC Admit Card.

Please note that candidates will not be permitted to enter the examination hall without the RRB NTPC Admit Card.

RRB NTPC 2024 Salary

The RRB NTPC Exam is conducted by the Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) to select candidates for various non-technical posts such as clerks, typists, ticket collectors, station masters, etc. The RRB NTPC 2024 Salary is one of the attractive aspects of this exam as it offers a decent pay scale along with various allowances and perks. The RRB NTPC salary varies depending on the post and the level of the 7th pay commission.

The basic pay for undergraduate posts ranges from Rs 19,900 to Rs 21,700, while the basic pay for graduate posts ranges from Rs 25,500 to Rs 35,400. In addition to the basic pay, the RRB NTPC salary also includes dearness allowance, a house rent allowance, travel allowance and other benefits.

The RRB NTPC salary also offers scope for promotion and career growth based on performance and seniority. The RRB NTPC exam is a golden opportunity for candidates who want to join the Indian Railways and enjoy a secure and comfortable job with a good salary.

RRB NTPC 2024 Cut Off

The RRB NTPC Cut Off will be released along with the result and scorecard on the official website of the respective RRBs. The RRB NTPC cutoff is released for different stages of the exam, such as CBT 1, CBT 2, CBAT, and document verification. The RRB NTPC cutoff is also released for different categories of candidates, such as UR, OBC, SC, ST, EWS, Ex-SM, etc.

The RRB NTPC cutoff varies for different posts and zones. Candidates can check the previous year and expected cutoff marks for RRB NTPC exam from various online sources to get an idea of the competition level and prepare accordingly.

RRB NTPC 2024 Result

The RRB NTPC Result will be declared on the official website of the respective RRBs after each stage of the exam, such as CBT 1, CBT 2, CBAT, and document verification. The candidates can check their RRB NTPC result by entering their registered user ID and password on the website.

RRB NTPC Previous Year Papers

The RRB NTPC previous year papers are helpful for the candidates who are preparing for the RRB NTPC exam as they provide an insight into the exam pattern, syllabus, and difficulty level. The candidates can download the RRB NTPC previous year papers from the table down below and practice them regularly to enhance their performance and score well in the exam.

RRB NTPC Exam Registration

The RRB NTPC Registration is the first step to apply for the exam conducted by the Railway Recruitment Board (RRB) for various non-technical posts in different zones and regions of Indian Railways.

The RRB NTPC registration will be available on the official regional websites of RRBs once the notification is released. The RRB NTPC registration process begins with the applicant’s submission of personal information like name, DOB, father’s name, and 10th grade roll number.

After registration, the candidates have to verify their email id and phone number using OTP. The RRB NTPC registration will generate a unique registration number and password for each candidate, which will be used for further login and application process.
